raw: * Mixin for supporting the background images on decorators.
* This mixin is usually used by {@link qx.ui.decoration.Decorator}.
* It is possible to define multiple background images by setting an
* array containing the needed values as the property value.
* In case multiple values are specified, the values of the properties
* are repeated until all match in length.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Mixin for supporting the background images on decorators. This mixin is usually used by {@link qx.ui.decoration.Decorator}. It is possible to define multiple background images by setting an array containing the needed values as the property value. In case multiple values are specified, the values of the properties are repeated until all match in length. An example: 

   'my-decorator': {
     style: {
       backgroundImage: ['foo1.png', 'foo2.png', 'bar1.png', 'bar2.png'],
       backgroundRepeat: 'no-repeat',
       backgroundPositionX: ['left', 'right', 'center'],
       backgroundPositionY: ['center', 'top']
     }
   }

which is the same as: 

   'my-decorator': {
     style: {
       backgroundImage: ['foo1.png', 'foo2.png', 'bar1.png', 'bar2.png'],
       backgroundRepeat: ['no-repeat', 'no-repeat', 'no-repeat', 'no-repeat'],
       backgroundPositionX: ['left', 'right', 'center', 'left'],
       backgroundPositionY: ['center', 'top', 'center', 'top']
     }
   }

raw: * The URL of the background image
* How the background image should be repeated

@description.name: @description
@description.body: How the background image should be repeated

raw: * Either a string or a number, which defines the horizontal position
* If the value is an integer it is interpreted as a pixel value, otherwise
* the value is taken to be a CSS value. For CSS, the values are "center",

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Either a string or a number, which defines the horizontal position of the background image. If the value is an integer it is interpreted as a pixel value, otherwise the value is taken to be a CSS value. For CSS, the values are "center", "left" and "right".

raw: * Either a string or a number, which defines the vertical position
* If the value is an integer it is interpreted as a pixel value, otherwise
* the value is taken to be a CSS value. For CSS, the values are "top",

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Either a string or a number, which defines the vertical position of the background image. If the value is an integer it is interpreted as a pixel value, otherwise the value is taken to be a CSS value. For CSS, the values are "top", "center" and "bottom".

raw: * Specifies where the background image is positioned.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Specifies where the background image is positioned.

raw: * Property group to define the background position

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Property group to define the background position

raw: * Whether to order gradients before Image-URL-based background declarations

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether to order gradients before Image-URL-based background declarations if both qx.ui.decoration.MBackgroundImage and qx.ui.decoration.MLinearBackgroundGradient decorations are used.

raw: * Adds the background-image styles to the given map

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Adds the background-image styles to the given map
